<h2>
<a id="user-content-equations" class="anchor" href="#equations" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Equations</h2>

<p>The deterministic part of the model is defined by this <strong>in-line equation</strong> as 
$\mu_i = \beta_0 + \beta_1x$, and the stochastic part by the <strong>centered equation</strong>: </p>

<p>$$ \frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi}\sigma}e^{-(x-\mu_i)^2/(2\sigma^2)} $$</p>

<p>The relationship was first described by
<code>r citet("10.1111/j.1461-0248.2005.00827.x")</code>. However, there are also opinions
that the relationship is spurious <code>r citep("10.1111/j.2041-210x.2012.00264.x")</code>.
We used R for our calculations <code>r citep(citation())</code>, and we used package <code>knitcitations</code> <code>r citep(citation("knitcitations"))</code> to make the bibliography.</p>
